benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allCustomFields - Retrieve account customFields

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC05, TC08-TC09, TC31) exercise successful retrieval with required and optional parameters and combinations.
Empty Response: TC06 and TC07 verify empty-array responses when no custom fields match.
Query Parameters: Extensive tests for objectType and audit enums, invalid formats, whitespace, unexpected types, unsupported params (TC02, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC32, TC36).
Authorization: Authentication missing/invalid token cases are present (TC14, TC15) verifying 401 behavior.
Error Handling: Invalid accountId formats and non-existent accounts covered (TC12, TC13) and SQL injection/XSS attempts covered (TC17, TC18).
Audit behavior: FULL, MINIMAL, NONE and regression check for audit handling covered (TC03, TC04, TC09, TC21).
Performance & Scalability: Large dataset and concurrency/performance scenarios included (TC11, TC25, TC26, TC30).
Resilience & Recovery: Service unavailable, transient errors, recovery and dependency failures covered (TC16, TC19, TC20, TC23, TC39).
Edge cases: Many edge cases around accountId length/empty/whitespace and minimal/maximal numbers covered (TC29, TC30, TC33, TC34, TC35).
Integration / Data consistency: Integration and cross-service consistency covered (TC24).
Accessibility & Error clarity: Accessibility and descriptive error messages covered (TC37, TC38).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination behavior (limit/offset or page tokens) or server-side paging headers despite very large dataset scenarios—TC11 asserts full return but not pagination semantics.
Caching Behavior / HTTP Headers: No assertions for response caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or validation of conditional GET behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit tests for API rate limiting (429 responses) or behavior under burst request rate even though concurrency/performance is present.
Authorization Coverage (roles/403): Tests cover missing/invalid auth (401) but do not cover insufficient permissions or role-based access resulting in 403 responses.
Pagination / Partial Deliveries: No tests for partial responses, continuation tokens, or behavior when “all” cannot be returned in a single response.

Content-Type and Schema Negative Tests: While schema matching is asserted on success, negative tests for malformed success responses, incorrect content-type, or missing fields in objects are not present.

Query Param Validation: There is no explicit test for invalid enum values for audit (e.g., "VERBOSE") returning appropriate 400; TC09 tests valid enums but invalid enum handling beyond XSS is missing.
Caching / Consistency under concurrent updates: No test that checks ETag-based concurrency or that stale cached responses are invalidated after updates to custom fields.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: simulate large datasets with server-side pagination; verify page size limits, next/prev links or tokens, and client behavior when paginated (and add tests that ensure single-call “all” behavior is not assumed).
Add caching header tests: verify ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified headers and conditional GET (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) behavior, including 304 responses.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate bursts to validate 429 behavior and retry-after headers, and verify graceful degradation under throttling.
Add authorization role tests: include scenarios where an authenticated user lacks permission (expect 403) and test bearer/token scope validation.
Add negative schema/content-type tests: assert content-type is application/json and validate behavior when response payloads are malformed or missing required CustomField properties.
Add invalid-enum tests: check server returns 400 for unsupported audit or objectType enum values (not only XSS), and confirm error messages are clear.
Add cache-consistency tests under concurrent updates: ensure updates to custom fields invalidate caches or change ETag values, avoiding stale reads.
Clarify pagination vs “all” semantics in requirements: if endpoint must always return everything, document limits; otherwise add tests for behavior when returning “all” is infeasible.
Add tests for 403 vs 401 distinction and for role/scoped tokens to fully cover authorization guidelines.
